item.description:
We are going to hike a section of the Tunxis Trail that will include Tory Den and the Mile of Ledges. This section is in Bristol and Burlington and will begin near Old Marsh Pond on Marsh Road. I am planning a 6 mile loop through this section. This hike will not have my usual "ups". The elevation gain is 300 ft and it looks to be a more level trail. It is described as rocky terrain.

This is a rugged and interesting section of our state's blue blaze trail. It offers picturesque rock ledges, a few climbing tight squeezes, and the historic Tory Den. During the Revolutionary War, Tories or British sympathizers,used the den as a hinding place. The Leatherman also used this as a resting place.

We are getting into warmer weather so include with you plenty of water, snacks, layers of clothing, bug spray, and sunscreen. Water proof hiking boots should be part of your gear.

The address is really close. Parking should be across the street from the pond.
http://www.mapquest.c...


The hike should take about three hours. I am planning to park on Marsh Rd near Old Marsh Pond. We will hike in on the Tunxis Mainline Blue Trail. We will then go left onto the yellow dot trail to explore Tory Den. We will hang a right onto Greer Rd then back onto the blue trail onto the Mile of Ledges and back the way we came..
